brief: to be left over, to be remaining
long: Meaning: to "jut" over or "exceed"; by implication, to "excel"; (intransitively) to "remain" or "be left"; causatively to "leave", "cause to abound", "preserve".  Usage: excel, leave (a remnant), left behind, too much, make plenteous, preserve, (be, let) remain(-der, -ing, -nant), reserve, residue, rest.  Source: a primitive root;
